1537913800157843456.text: In contrast, the special rules of qualified immunity make way for circuit court review of QI.  So you get lots of QI decisions in the appellate courts.  And there's a lot less litigation than I would have expected arising in the criminal context of a motion to suppress.

1537790717682241536.text: @TectusVulpes @Gilbert__Gumbo @chercecilia @MicahGoring @GovernorTomWolf The 14th requires due process for any deprivation of “life, liberty, or property.” It applies outside the criminal context. For example, if the government wants to take your home to build a highway (eminent domain), you’re entitled to due process prior to that occurring.
